item.title: Weather may remain mainly dry
item.description: The Bangladesh Meteorological Department (BMD) forecast the weather may remain mainly dry with partly cloudy sky across the country over the next 24 hours, beginning at 9:00 am today (Thursday). item.title: US buys more Argentine pesos, Bessent says
item.description: The US again purchased Argentine pesos in the open market on Wednesday, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent told reporters, adding that the department was working with banks and investment funds to create a $20 billion facility to invest in the South American country's sovereign debt. Bessent said du

item.title: Obaidul Quader’s younger brother arrested in Dhaka
item.description: Detectives have detained Md Shahadat Hossain, younger of former minister Obaidul Quader and eight others involved with Awami League politics, in Dhaka. Muhammad Talebur Rahman, deputy commissioner (DC-Media) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police (DMP), said this on Thursday morning. A Detective Branch (DB

item.title: Girls outperform boys in HSC results
item.description: Female students in the Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC) and equivalent examinations-2025 have outnumbered their male counterparts in achieving higher pass rate and a greater number of GPA-5 achievers likewise previous years. The average pass rate across the 11 education boards this year st

item.title: HSC result re-scrutiny applications open tomorrow
item.description: The results of this year's HSC and equivalent examinations were published today at 10 am. Students who are not satisfied with the results will have the opportunity to apply for re-scrutiny or challenge their marks, as in previous years. Students can apply for re-scrutiny from tomorrow, Octo

item.title: Nestle to axe 16,000 jobs
item.description: Nestle will axe 16,000 jobs as it tries to raise sales volumes, new CEO Philipp Navratil said on Thursday, as the world's largest packaged food company reported better-than-expected sales growth thanks to pricing-led upticks in coffee and confectionery. Navratil, the former head of Nespresso, repl

item.title: KU expels 12 students over misconduct
item.description: Khulna University (KU) has expelled 12 students and imposed disciplinary measures on seven others for their involvement in ragging, assault, drug use, and religious defamation. Prof Nazmus Sadat, Director of Student Affairs of the university, confirmed the matter, reports BSS. The decisions were

item.title: SC to resume regular judicial proceedings from Oct 19
item.description: The Supreme Court (SC) will resume its regular judicial activities from October 19, after the vacation that began on September 7, and continue through October 18, including public and weekly holidays.
